snippet.title: A Model of Spike Initiation in Neocortical Pyramidal Neurons
snippet.description:
* A Model of Spike Initiation in Neocortical Pyramidal Neurons (Citations: 116)
Zachary F. Mainen, John R. Huguenard, Terrence J. Sejnowski
Summary Neocortical pyramidal cells possess voltage-depend- ent dendritic sodium channels that promote propaga- tion of action potentials into the dendritic tree but para- doxically may fail to originate dendritic spikes. A biophysical model was constructed to reconcile these observations with known anatomical and physioiogi- cai properties. When dendritic and somatic sodium channel densities compatible with electrophysiologi- cal measurements were ...
Journal: Nature , 1995

snippet.title: A Novel Rat Model of Carotid Artery Stenting for the Understanding of Restenosis in Metabolic Diseases
snippet.description:
* A Novel Rat Model of Carotid Artery Stenting for the Understanding of Restenosis in Metabolic Diseases (Citations: 30)
Aloke V. Finn, Herman K. Gold, Anita Tang, Deena K. Weber, Thomas N. Wight, Allen Clermont, Renu Virmani, Frank D. Kolodgie
The effects of risk modifiers such as diabetes, obesity and hypertension on vascular healing after stent deployment are largely unknown, because of a lack of an appropriate animal model to study. Since many inbred strains of rats expressing these phenotypes are available, we validated a carotid artery model of in-stent restenosis in the rat. A detailed histomorphometric analysis was ...
Journal: Journal of Vascular Research - J VASC RES , vol. 39, no. 5, pp. 414-425, 2002
